001
002package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node;
003
004import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.StaticContext;
005import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format.IPathFormatter;
006import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format.IPathSegment;
007import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItemVisitor;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.IItemType;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IResourceLocation;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
013
014import java.net.URI;
015import java.util.Collection;
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.stream.Stream;
018
019import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
020import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
021
022/**
023 * Represents a queryable Metapath model node.
024 */
025public interface INodeItem extends IItem, IPathSegment, INodeItemVisitable {
026  @NonNull
027  static IItemType type() {
028    return IItemType.node();
029  }
030
031  /**
032   * Retrieve the relative position of this node relative to sibling nodes.
033   * <p>
034   * A singleton item in a sequence will have a position value of {@code 1}.
035   * <p>
036   * The value {@code 1} is used as the starting value to align with the XPath
037   * specification.
038   *
039   * @return a positive integer value designating this instance's position within
040   *         a collection
041   */
042  default int getPosition() {
043    // only model node items have positions other than 1
044    return 1;
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Generate a path for this node in the directed node graph, using the provided
049   * path formatter.
050   */
051  @Override
052  String format(IPathFormatter formatter);
053
054  /**
055   * Gets the value of the provided node item.
056   * <p>
057   * If the provided node item is a document, this method get the first child node
058   * item's value, since a document doesn't have a value.
059   *
060   * @param <CLASS>
061   *          the type of the bound object to return
062   * @param item
063   *          the node item to get the value of
064   * @return a bound object
065   * @throws NullPointerException
066   *           if the node item has no associated value
067   */
068  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
069  @NonNull
070  static <CLASS> CLASS toValue(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
071    INodeItem valuedItem;
072    if (item instanceof IDocumentNodeItem) {
073      // get first child item, since the document has no value
074      valuedItem = item.modelItems().findFirst().get();
075    } else {
076      valuedItem = item;
077    }
078    return ObjectUtils.requireNonNull((CLASS) valuedItem.getValue());
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Retrieve the parent node item if it exists.
083   *
084   * @return the parent node item, or {@code null} if this node item has no known
085   *         parent
086   */
087  INodeItem getParentNodeItem();
088
089  /**
090   * Retrieve the parent content node item if it exists. A content node is a
091   * non-document node.
092   *
093   * @return the parent content node item, or {@code null} if this node item has
094   *         no known parent content node item
095   */
096  IModelNodeItem<?, ?> getParentContentNodeItem();
097
098  /**
099   * Get the kind of node item this is.
100   *
101   * @return the node item's kind
102   */
103  @NonNull
104  NodeItemKind getNodeItemKind();
105
106  /**
107   * Retrieve the base URI of this node.
108   * <p>
109   * The base URI of a node will be in order of preference:
110   * <ol>
111   * <li>the base URI defined on the node</li>
112   * <li>the base URI defined on the nearest ancestor node</li>
113   * <li>the base URI defined on the document node</li>
114   * <li>{@code null} if the document node is unknown</li>
115   * </ol>
116   *
117   * @return the base URI or {@code null} if it is unknown
118   */
119  URI getBaseUri();
120
121  /**
122   * Get the path for this node item as a Metapath.
123   *
124   * @return the Metapath
125   */
126  @NonNull
127  default String getMetapath() {
128    return toPath(IPathFormatter.METAPATH_PATH_FORMATER);
129  }
130
131  @Override
132  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> getPathStream() {
133    INodeItem parent = getParentNodeItem();
134    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
135        parent == null ? Stream.of(this) : Stream.concat(getParentNodeItem().getPathStream(), Stream.of(this)));
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Get a stream of all ancestors of this node item. The stream is ordered from
140   * closest to farthest ancestor.
141   *
142   * @return a stream of ancestor node items
143   */
144  @NonNull
145  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestor() {
146    return ancestorsOf(this);
147  }
148
149  /**
150   * Get a stream of this and all ancestors of this node item. The stream is
151   * ordered from self, then closest to farthest ancestor.
152   *
153   * @return a stream of this node followed by all ancestor node items
154   */
155  @NonNull
156  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestorOrSelf() {
157    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.concat(Stream.of(this), ancestor()));
158  }
159
160  /**
161   * Get a stream of the ancestors of the provided {@code item}. The stream is
162   * ordered from the closest to farthest ancestor.
163   *
164   * @param item
165   *          the target item to get ancestors for
166   *
167   * @return a stream of all ancestor node items
168   */
169  @NonNull
170  static Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestorsOf(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
171    INodeItem parent = item.getParentNodeItem();
172    return ObjectUtils.notNull(parent == null ? Stream.empty() : Stream.concat(Stream.of(parent), ancestorsOf(parent)));
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * Get a stream of all descendant model items of this node item. The stream is
177   * ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a depth-first order.
178   *
179   * @return a stream of descendant node items
180   */
181  @NonNull
182  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> descendant() {
183    return decendantsOf(this);
184  }
185
186  /**
187   * Get a stream of all descendant model items of the provided {@code item}. The
188   * stream is ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a depth-first
189   * order.
190   *
191   * @param item
192   *          the target item to get descendants for
193   *
194   * @return a stream of descendant node items
195   */
196  @NonNull
197  static Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> decendantsOf(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
198    Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> children = item.modelItems();
199
200    return ObjectUtils.notNull(children.flatMap(child -> {
201      assert child != null;
202      return Stream.concat(Stream.of(child), decendantsOf(child));
203    }));
204  }
205
206  /**
207   * Get a stream of this node, followed by all descendant model items of this
208   * node item. The stream is ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a
209   * depth-first order.
210   *
211   * @return a stream of this node and descendant node items
212   */
213  @NonNull
214  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> descendantOrSelf() {
215    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.concat(Stream.of(this), descendant()));
216  }
217
218  /**
219   * Get the children of this node's parent that occur after this node in a
220   * depth-first order.
221   *
222   * @return a stream of nodes
223   */
224  @NonNull
225  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> followingSibling() {
226    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.empty());
227  }
228
229  /**
230   * Get the children of this node's parent, and their descendants, that occur
231   * before this node in a depth-first order.
232   *
233   * @return a stream of nodes
234   */
235  @NonNull
236  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> precedingSibling() {
237    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.empty());
238  }
239
240  /**
241   * Get the children of this node's parent, and their descendants, that occur
242   * before this node in a depth-first order.
243   *
244   * @return a stream of nodes
245   */
246  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> following() {
247    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.empty());
248  }
249
250  /**
251   * Get the children of this node's parent, and their descendants, that occur
252   * after this node in a depth-first order.
253   *
254   * @return a stream of nodes
255   */
256  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> preceding() {
257    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.empty());
258  }
259
260  /**
261   * Get the flags and value data associated this node. The resulting collection
262   * is expected to be ordered, with the results in document order.
263   * <p>
264   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
265   * safe
266   *
267   * @return a collection of flags
268   */
269  @NonNull
270  Collection<? extends IFlagNodeItem> getFlags();
271
272  /**
273   * Lookup a flag and value data on this node by it's effective qualified name.
274   *
275   * @param name
276   *          the effective qualified name of the flag
277   * @return the flag with the matching effective name or {@code null} if no match
278   *         was found
279   */
280  @Nullable
281  IFlagNodeItem getFlagByName(@NonNull IEnhancedQName name);
282
283  /**
284   * Get the flags and value data associated with this node as a stream.
285   *
286   * @return the stream of flags or an empty stream if none exist
287   */
288  @SuppressWarnings("null")
289  @NonNull
290  default Stream<? extends IFlagNodeItem> flags() {
291    return getFlags().stream();
292  }
293
294  /**
295   * Get the model items (i.e., fields, assemblies) and value data associated this
296   * node. A given model instance can be multi-valued, so the value of each
297   * instance will be a list. The resulting collection is expected to be ordered,
298   * with the results in document order.
299   * <p>
300   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
301   * safe
302   *
303   * @return a collection of list(s), with each list containing the items for a
304   *         given model instance
305   */
306  @NonNull
307  Collection<? extends List<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>>> getModelItems();
308
309  /**
310   * Get the collection of model items associated with the instance having the
311   * provided {@code name}.
312   * <p>
313   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
314   * safe
315   *
316   * @param name
317   *          the instance name to get model items for
318   * @return the sequence of items associated with the named model instance, or an
319   *         empty list if an instance with that name is not present
320   */
321  @NonNull
322  List<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> getModelItemsByName(@NonNull IEnhancedQName name);
323
324  /**
325   * Get the model items (i.e., fields, assemblies) and value data associated this
326   * node as a stream.
327   *
328   * @return the stream of model items or an empty stream if none exist
329   */
330  @SuppressWarnings("null")
331  @NonNull
332  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> modelItems() {
333    return getModelItems().stream().flatMap(Collection::stream);
334  }
335
336  /**
337   * Get the resource location information for the node, if known.
338   *
339   * @return the resource location information, or {@code null} if not known
340   */
341  @Nullable
342  IResourceLocation getLocation();
343
344  /**
345   * Get the string value of the node.
346   *
347   * @return the string value of the node or an empty string if it has no value.
348   */
349  @NonNull
350  String stringValue();
351
352  /**
353   * Get the static context to use to query this node item.
354   *
355   * @return the static context
356   */
357  @NonNull
358  StaticContext getStaticContext();
359
360  @Override
361  default void accept(IItemVisitor visitor) {
362    visitor.visit(this);
363  }
364}
